The report is not a final report on the IRS Targeting scandal but it nonetheless draws on more documents & interviews than any other so far.
These employees expressed a general loathing toward them even while begrudgingly admitting that those organizations were in compliance.
Those interviews were with IRS, Treasury, & Justice Department employees. The report concludes that:
The report represents findings from the review of over 1.3 million pages of documents and 52 transcribed interviews.
It's full title - The Internal Revenue Service's Targeting of Conservative Tax-Exempt Applicants: Report of Findings for the 113th Congress

#FITARA fixes this crisis of leadership and ensures that the contracting standard is modernized to handle a changed tech landscape.
As tech changes, CIOs were previously prevented from adopting new technologies, and often Americans missed out on more effective options.
Giving decision makers the ability to make changes appropriate for their agency will ensure that solutions are enacted.
Each year, the federal government spends $80 Bil on IT systems, yet much is wasted on cost overruns, long delays, and outdated programs.
#FITARA will improve IT of federal gov and increase transparency of IT spending. Now included in NDAA. http://t.co/xg9v0tOhpW @TomCoburn
